sizefmt

This small library allows to easily format file sizes in a human-readable format.

Authors:
Nicolas Sicard

License:
www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt, Boost License 1.0

Source:
https://github.com/biozic/sizefmt

struct SizeBase(Config config);
Wraps a size value of type which is formatted appropriately when output as text.

ulong value;
The size that should be formatted.

const void toString(scope void delegate(const(char)[]) sink, FormatSpec!char fmt);
Formats the size according to the format fmt, automatically choosing the prefix and performing the unit conversion.

The size is formatted as a floating point value, so fmt has to be a floating-point-value format specification (s, f, F, e, E, g, G, a or A). But when the unit is just bytes, it is formatted as an integer.

alias Size = SizeBase!(Config("B", "byte", "bytes", cast(PrefixUse)0, cast(Spacing)1, false)).SizeBase;
Size struct with default options.

Examples:
assert("%s".format(Size(1)) == "1 B");
assert("%s".format(Size(42)) == "42 B");
assert("%g".format(Size(1024)) == "1 KB");
assert("%.2f".format(Size(2_590_000)) == "2.47 MB");


struct Config;
Configuration of size format.

string symbol;
The symbol of the size unit.

string unitName;
The name of the size unit (singular).

string unitNamePlural;
The name of the size unit (plural).

PrefixUse prefixUse;
The type of prefix used along with the symbol.

Spacing spacing;
The spacing between the value and the unit.

bool useNameIfNoPrefix;
Whether to use the name of the symbol if there is no prefix.

template config(string configString)
Builds a configuration from a JSON-like string.

Examples:
alias MySize = SizeBase!(config!`{
    symbol: "O",
    unitName: "octet",
    unitNamePlural: "octets",
    prefixUse: PrefixUse.IEC,
    spacing: Spacing.tabular,
    useNameIfNoPrefix: true
}`);

assert("|%4.1f|".format(MySize(1))         == "|   1 octet |");
assert("|%4.1f|".format(MySize(42))        == "|  42 octets|");
assert("|%4.1f|".format(MySize(1024))      == "| 1.0 KiO   |");
assert("|%4.1f|".format(MySize(2_590_000)) == "| 2.5 MiO   |");


enum PrefixUse: int;
The use of prefix when formatting long size values.

binary
Sizes will be formatted using the traditional binary prefixes, e.g. 1024 bytes = 1 kilobyte = 1 KB.

IEC
Sizes will be formatted using the IEC recommandations for binary prefixes equivalent of a multiple of 1024, e.g. 1024 bytes = kibibyte = 1 KiB.

decimal
Sizes will be formatted using decimal prefixes, e.g. 1024 bytes = 1.024 kilobyte = 1.024 kB.

enum Spacing: int;
The type of spacing around the symbol of the size unit.

none
No space between the value and the unit.

singleSpace
A single space between the value and the unit.

tabular
The right amount of space so that sizes can be vertically aligned in a table. In order to achieve this vertical alignement, the value itself must be formatted as a fixed-size string.
